g.text: , we set about to generate mutants of Mp
CRISPR/Cas9 system (Sugano et al. 2018; Sugano et al. 2014). We identified multiple mutants
corresponding to three target regions (Fig. 1A, Fig. S2). Using the method of sporeling
transformation (Ishizaki et al. 2008), two insertion and two deletion mutants were obtained, all
containing a premature stop codon after the mutation site (Fig. S2). The Mp
second and third exon and located in first and second
exon, and caused the deletion of a part of the DNA methyltransferase domain (Fig. 1A). All
mutant thalli (haploid gametophytic vegetative tissue) exhibited abnormal shape,
reduced size and growth delay (Fig. 1B-D, Fig. S3).
side of the thallus for asexual reproduction, called the gemmae cup. Inside the gemmae cup,
vegetative clones called gemmae are formed. However, Mp
gemmae cups nor gemmae. Furthermore, even under inductive conditions, neither female nor
mutants did not develop organs for sexual reproduction (archegoniophore and
antheridiophore). After incubation on B5 media for more than a month, Mp
generated many adventitious shoot-like structures and rhizoids on thallus (Fig. 1E). Dorsal
structures, including air chambers and air pores, were formed but disorganized, and many
undifferentiated cells were found on the surface of Mp
failed to develop a normal expansion pattern and lacked lateral growth. These
is necessary for promoting cell differentiation, maintaining
differentiated cellular identities, or both in
